title: First Eyeballs, Now Palms: TON Offers $5 Million for Latest ‘Proof of Personhood’ Push
description: Biometrics developer HumanCode joins The Open Network to offer $5 million in Toncoin for enrolling in an AI-powered palm-scanning program.

title: 1 in 6 new Base meme coins are scams, 91% have vulnerabilities
description:
A new analysis of 1000 new meme coins on Base suggests 91% have at least one security vulnerability while 16.9% are outright scams.

Ever since the Dencun upgrade that dramatically lowered fees on Ethereum layer 2s, Coinbases not-very-decentralized rollup Base has surged in user numbers, transactions and total value locked.

As with the fast and cheap L1 blockchain Solana, most of the activity is being fuelled by degenerate gambling on memecoins, with hopefuls vying to make life-changing amounts of money from a small outlay.

But an investigation by Magazine has found the vast majority of memecoins on the platform have security vulnerabilities that could expose users to big losses.

And almost one in five are deliberately malicious and use a variety of tricks to steal user funds.

Magazine compiled security profiles of 1,000 new Base tokens virtually all of them memecoins or scams launched between March 19 to 25. This is not a comprehensive audit, as there are more than 380,000 ERC-20 tokens on Base currently; however, it is a representative sample of 1,000 tokens launched that week.

The tokens were analyzed by automated auditors on the trading analytics platform DEXTools to determine whether each project has implemented three fundamental security measures: locked liquidity, verified contracts and absence of honeypots.

Read more

title: Exploring Bitget: The world’s up-and-coming crypto exchange
description:
Bitget is a rapidly growing cryptocurrency exchange registered in Seychelles that has become the world’s largest crypto copy trading platform. Established in 2018, Bitget now serves over 25 million registered users globally and boasts an impressive $10+ billion USDT daily trading volume.  With a global team of over 1,300 employees from 60 countries, Bitget is […]

title: Coinbase Anticipates Bitcoin Dips to Be ‘More Aggressively Bought’ Than Previous Cycles
description: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase says bitcoin dips are likely to be “more aggressively bought compared to previous cycles, even as volatility persists during price discovery.” The crypto firm noted that the impact of U.S. spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and the larger inflow of institutional demand can be seen in the open interest of bitcoin futures.
